DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Donor Suspected Rabies Animal Bite Injury Prior 12 Month Receive Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication of whether the donor had a bite from an animal suspected to have rabies in the last 12 months as provided by the primary history source.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tissue Donor Suspected Rabies Animal Bite Injury Prior 12 Month Receive
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person._Believed likely._A life-threatening viral infection caused by the neurotropic Rabies virus. It is transmitted to humans usually from a bite by an infected dog. The initial signs and symptoms include malaise, fever, and headache, followed by the central nervous system manifestations which include abrupt behavioral changes. Paralysis, lethargy, and coma follow the behavioral changes._A living organism that has membranous cell walls, requires oxygen and organic foods, and is capable of voluntary movement, as distinguished from a plant or mineral._A wound inflicted by the teeth or fangs of an individual or animal._Earlier in time or order._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::12_One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks._To take, accept, or get something offered.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Concepts.definition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Property.preferredName: Suspected Rabies Animal Bite Injury Prior Integer::12 Month Receive
Property.preferredDefinition: Believed likely.:A life-threatening viral infection caused by the neurotropic Rabies virus. It is transmitted to humans usually from a bite by an infected dog. The initial signs and symptoms include malaise, fever, and headache, followed by the central nervous system manifestations which include abrupt behavioral changes. Paralysis, lethargy, and coma follow the behavioral changes.:A living organism that has membranous cell walls, requires oxygen and organic foods, and is capable of voluntary movement, as distinguished from a plant or mineral.:A wound inflicted by the teeth or fangs of an individual or animal.:Earlier in time or order.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::12:One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.:To take, accept, or get something offered.

Concepts.definition: A life-threatening viral infection caused by the neurotropic Rabies virus. It is transmitted to humans usually from a bite by an infected dog. The initial signs and symptoms include malaise, fever, and headache, followed by the central nervous system manifestations which include abrupt behavioral changes. Paralysis, lethargy, and coma follow the behavioral changes.
A living organism that has membranous cell walls, requires oxygen and organic foods, and is capable of voluntary movement, as distinguished from a plant or mineral.
A wound inflicted by the teeth or fangs of an individual or animal.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
To take, accept, or get something offered.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves
